success_criteria: input element or button is missing an associated label, it contains an alt attribute, or its label is empty

error_fixes.problem_type: Input element or button is missing an associated label, it contains an alt attribute, or its label is empty
error_fixes.offending_line: <button type="button" onclick="submitForm()" style="background-color: #45a049;"> <!-- Adjusted background color for better contrast -->
error_fixes.fixed_line: <button type="button" onclick="submitForm()" aria-label="Book Now" style="background-color: #45a049;"> <!-- Adjusted background color for better contrast -->
error_fixes.CoT:
First, let's identify all the input elements and buttons in the form. 
- We have an input element with type "number" for the number of tickets.
- We have an input element with type "text" for the user's name.
- We have a button with the text "Book Now".

Next, we need to check if each input element and button has an associated label.
- The input element for number of tickets has a label with the text "Number of Tickets".
- The input element for the user's name doesn't have an associated label. Instead, the label is empty, but the placeholder text in the input field provides the necessary context.
- The button for booking does not have an associated label.

Based on the assessment, the input element for the user's name doesn't have a visible label, which could be an accessibility issue for users who rely on screen readers. Having a visible label or an associated label through the "for" attribute would help improve accessibility for these users.

success_criteria: Audio or video element should avoid automatically playing audio
fixed_example:
<video controls>
<source src="bookstore-video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

success_criteria: <b> <i> or <font> tag should not be used

error_fixes.problem_type: Use of <marquee> tag for the header
error_fixes.CoT:
Step 1: Identify any <b>, <i>, or <font> tags in the HTML code. 
Step 2: Determine if any of these tags are being used for styling purposes.
Step 3: If any of these tags are used for styling, consider refactoring the code to use CSS instead for better accessibility.
Step 4: Make necessary changes in the code to remove the <b>, <i>, or <font> tags.

success_criteria: onmousedown event missing onkeydown event or script is not keyboard accessible

error_fixes.problem_type: onmousedown event used without onkeydown event
error_fixes.offending_line: <button type="button" onclick="submitForm()" style="background-color: #45a049;"> <!-- Adjusted background color for better contrast -->
error_fixes.fixed_line: <button type="button" onclick="submitForm()" onkeydown="submitForm()" style="background-color: #45a049;"> <!-- Adjusted background color for better contrast -->
error_fixes.CoT:
1. Identify interactive elements on the page that could potentially require keyboard interaction.
2. Check if the interactive elements have appropriate keyboard event handlers like `onkeydown`.
3. Look for any elements or scripts that rely solely on `onmousedown` event for interaction.
4. Determine if there are any keyboard accessibility issues present.
5. Provide recommendations to make the interactive elements keyboard accessible.

success_criteria: meta refresh with a time-out is used.

4. If the <title> element is empty or does not provide relevant information, then there is an accessibility issue.

success_criteria: document language not identified or incorrect

error_fixes.problem_type: document language not identified or incorrect
error_fixes.CoT:
Step 1: Identify the language attribute in the "html" tag.
Step 2: Ensure the language attribute value is correctly set to the language of the document.

success_criteria: input element has more than one associated label

error_fixes.problem_type: Input element has more than one associated label
error_fixes.CoT:
1. Identify all input elements in the form.
2. Check each input element to see how many labels are associated with it.
3. If any input element has more than one label associated with it, then it violates the accessibility rule.

success_criteria: element does not have complete start and end tags or id attribute is not unique

error_fixes.problem_type: Element does not have complete start and end tags
error_fixes.CoT:
To identify the issue of incomplete start and end tags or non-unique id attributes, we will:

1. Check each element in the HTML for complete start and end tags.
2. Ensure that each element with an id attribute has a unique id value.

Let's start by going through the HTML and checking each element for these issues.
